name: Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church
description:
In its neighborhood of South Ardmore, Bethel AME Church is one of three churches in a close-knit, traditionally African-American community. The building, as it stands today, is a little more than 40 years old, the original building having burned to a shell in 1973. The congregation rebuilt, with the change that the front of the church was shifted from Walnut Avenue to Sheldon Lane.

Haverford students have volunteered at Bethel in a variety of ways, most often helping in their community garden, as seen below.

Bethel also has a need for administrative help, and they are initiating a new internship:

Assistance is needed with community outreach, community development and engagement - additionally helping the organization and its subsidiaries promoting their message, work, events and the like. Interns will be expected to meet weekly with the head of the organization, ensure that social media handles are as "current' as possible, assist in staffing of events. Promises to be a great opportunity to get exposed to the varying levels of organizational development and community engagement. 
 
https://www.bethelardmore.org/
